items.title: Le Morne Brabant
items.description: A stunning beach with scenic viewpoints and guided hikes to the summit. Highly recommended to combine with an aerial view of the famous underwater waterfall illusion.

items.title: Black River Gorges National Park
items.description: The largest national park on the island, featuring hiking trails, panoramic viewpoints, and lush tropical forests.

items.title: Trou aux Cerfs – Dormant Volcano Crater
items.description: A dormant volcanic crater offering a full panoramic view of Mauritius' central region.

items.id: Port Louis Central Market & Caudan Waterfront
items.title: Port Louis Central Market & Caudan Waterfront
items.description: A bustling central market and vibrant waterfront area with shops, food stalls, and local culture.

items.title: Ile aux Cerfs
items.description: A stunning tropical island with white-sand beaches, turquoise waters, water sports, boat tours, and complete relaxation. One of the most beautiful spots in Mauritius.

items.title: Seven Colored Earth – Chamarel
items.description: A unique natural phenomenon where colorful sand forms layered dunes. A must-see attraction in Mauritius.

items.title: Chamarel Waterfall
items.description: One of the most impressive waterfalls on the island, plunging nearly 100 meters into lush tropical forest.

items.title: La Vanille Nature Park
items.description: A wonderful nature park featuring giant tortoises, crocodiles, monkeys, and more. A fun and educational experience for all ages.

items.title: Grand Baie
items.description: A lively coastal town known for its beautiful beaches, shopping, restaurants, nightlife, and boat excursions.

items.title: The Western Wall
items.description: The Western Wall is the last remnant of the Second Temple and the holiest site for the Jewish people, attracting millions of visitors and worshippers from around the world.

items.title: The Dead Sea
items.description: The lowest place on earth, famous for its mineral-rich salty waters — a unique natural floating experience.

items.title: Mahane Yehuda Market
items.description: A lively and iconic marketplace in Jerusalem, offering food stalls, fresh produce, local flavors, and authentic day-to-day Israeli culture.

items.title: Haifa & The Bahá'í Gardens
items.description: A beautiful coastal city featuring the famous Bahá'í Gardens, panoramic viewpoints, and a blend of natural beauty and urban charm.

items.title: Mount Hermon
items.description: Israel’s highest mountain, offering breathtaking views, winter snow activities, and beautiful summer hiking trails.

items.title: The Sea of Galilee
items.description: A freshwater lake surrounded by mountains, known as the heart of the Galilee region — perfect for swimming, boating, and peaceful sunsets.

items.title: Eilat
items.description: Israel’s southern resort city, featuring golden beaches, colorful coral reefs, and tax-free shopping in a sunny, relaxed atmosphere.

items.title: Rosh Hanikra
items.description: A breathtaking natural site at the northern tip of Israel, featuring sea-carved grottoes, the steepest cable car in the world, and stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea.

items.title: Tel Aviv Port
items.description: A beautiful seaside promenade with restaurants, shops, galleries, and a lively atmosphere. One of Tel Aviv’s most popular areas for walking, dining, and watching sunsets.
